I am also considering buying a joystick for KSP. But the last time I used one was about 10 years ago. What do you need to watch for when you buy one?

Three things--robustness, robustness and err, robustness. Yes, a lot of cheap joysticks easily wear out their pots (potentiometers) early, making for very erratic control. Get a good brand like Thrustmaster, Saitek, CH, and Logitech, don't go for generic ones. Don't be attracted to DOZENS of buttons or "forcefeedback" (you can't have that for KSP anyways)--always check the feel--it has to be firm and you really have to 'work it' while using it, the ones that tend to feel "loose" or "easily moved" sometimes are the ones with bad pots. Also, try to get one with a twist rudder, because you can have pitch, yaw and roll control all in ONE hand. You can actually have a second joystick and use that one's rudders and/or throttles and other buttons--or if you feel like a space cowboy, bind the translation controls to the other stick!
